com.viaoa.hub

Class HubFilter<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.viaoa.hub.HubListenerAdapter<T>
      • com.viaoa.hub.HubFilter<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HubListener<T>, OAFilter<T>, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    HubCopy, HubTrigger

    public class HubFilter<T>
extends HubListenerAdapter<T>
implements java.io.Serializable, OAFilter<T>
    HubFilter is used to create a Hub that has objects that are filtered from another Hub.

    All that is needed is to subclass the HubFilter and implement the "isUsed()" method to know if an object is to be included in the filtered Hub.

    Example

        Hub hubFiltered = new Hub(Employee.class)
    new HubFilter(hubAllEmployees, hubFiltered) {
        public boolean isUsed(Object obj) {
            // .... code to check if object should be added to hubFilter
        }
    };

    For more information about this package, see documentation.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • getHub

        public Hub<T> getHub()

      • setServerSideOnly

        public void setServerSideOnly(boolean b)
        This needs to be set to true if it is only created on the server, but client applications will be using the same Hub that is filtered. This is so that changes on the hub will be published to the clients, even if initiated on OAClientThread.

      • isUsed

        public boolean isUsed(T object)
        Method used to know if object should be in filtered hub. HubFilter will automatically listen to Master hub and call this method when needed.
        Specified by:
        isUsed in interface OAFilter<T>
        Returns:
        true to include object (default)

      • getObject

        public T getObject(T object)
        This is called when isUsed() is true, to get the object to use.
        This can be overwritten to replace the object with another object.

        protected void afterRemoveFromFilteredHub(T obj)

      • addLikeFilter

        public void addLikeFilter(java.lang.String propPath,
                 java.lang.Object value)
        Create a filter that is used on every object for this finder. The filter will be true if there is a least one matching value in the property path;
        Parameters:
        propPath - property path from this Finder from object to the object that will be compared.
        value - value to compare with using OACompare.isLike(..).
